`CatalogSubscriptionPlan`.

The subscription plan data is stored in the `subscription_plan_data` field of the 
`CatalogObject`.

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM_OPTION
x-enum-elements.description:
Represents a list of item option values that can be assigned to item
variations. For example, a color option or size option for a t-shirt.

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM_OPTION_VAL
x-enum-elements.description:
Represents an option value associated with one or more item options.
For example, an item option of "Size" may have item option values such as
Small" or "Medium".

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE_DEFINITION
x-enum-elements.description: Represents the definition of a custom attribute

x-enum-elements.name: QUICK_AMOUNTS_SETTINGS
x-enum-elements.description:
Represents a set of Quick Amounts and their settings at each location.
For example, a location may have a list of both AUTO and MANUAL quick amounts that are set to DISABLED.

CatalogObjectType.description:
Possible types of CatalogObjects returned from the Catalog, each
containing type-specific properties in the `*_data` field corresponding to the object type.

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_PRICING
x-enum-elements.description: The catalog item variation's price is fixed.

x-enum-elements.name: VARIABLE_PRICING
x-enum-elements.description: The catalog item variation's price is entered at the time of sale.

CatalogPricingType.description: Indicates whether the price of a CatalogItemVariation should be entered manually at the time of sale.

x-enum-elements.name: QUICK_AMOUNT_TYPE_MANUAL
x-enum-elements.description: Quick Amount is created manually by the seller.

x-enum-elements.name: QUICK_AMOUNT_TYPE_AUTO
x-enum-elements.description: Quick Amount is generated automatically by machine learning algorithms.

CatalogQuickAmountType.description: Determines the type of a specific Quick Amount.

x-enum-elements.name: DISABLED
x-enum-elements.description: Option for seller to disable Quick Amounts.

x-enum-elements.name: MANUAL
x-enum-elements.description: Option for seller to choose manually created Quick Amounts.

x-enum-elements.name: AUTO
x-enum-elements.description: Option for seller to choose automatically created Quick Amounts.

CatalogQuickAmountsSettingsOption.description: Determines a seller's option on Quick Amounts feature.

x-enum-elements.name: GS
x-enum-elements.description: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

x-enum-elements.name: SH
x-enum-elements.description: Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha

Country.description:
Indicates the country associated with another entity, such as a business.
Values are in [ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 format](http://www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/country_codes.htm).

Currency.description:
Indicates the associated currency for an amount of money. Values correspond
to [ISO 4217](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217).

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER
x-enum-elements.description:
Default creation source. Typically used for backward/future
compatibility when the original source of a customer profile is
unrecognized. For example, when older clients do not support newer
source types.

x-enum-elements.name: APPOINTMENTS
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile created automatically when an appointment
was scheduled.

x-enum-elements.name: COUPON
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile created automatically when a coupon was issued
using Square Point of Sale.

x-enum-elements.name: DELETION_RECOVERY
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile restored through Square's deletion recovery
process.

x-enum-elements.name: DIRECTORY
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile created manually through Square Dashboard or
Point of Sale application.

x-enum-elements.name: EGIFTING
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile created automatically when a gift card was
issued using Square Point of Sale. Customer profiles are created for
both the purchaser and the recipient of the gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: EMAIL_COLLECTION
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile created through Square Point of Sale when
signing up for marketing emails during checkout.

x-enum-elements.name: FEEDBACK
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile created automatically when providing feedback
through a digital receipt.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPORT
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile created automatically when importing customer
data through Square Dashboard.

x-enum-elements.name: INVOICES
x-enum-elements.description: Customer profile created automatically during an invoice payment.

x-enum-elements.name: LOYALTY
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile created automatically when customers provide a
phone number for loyalty reward programs during checkout.

x-enum-elements.name: MARKETING
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile created as the result of a campaign managed
through Squares Facebook integration.

x-enum-elements.name: MERGE
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile created as the result of explicitly merging
multiple customer profiles through the Square Dashboard or Point of
Sale application.

x-enum-elements.name: ONLINE_STORE
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile created through Square's Online Store solution
(legacy service).

x-enum-elements.name: INSTANT_PROFILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile created automatically as the result of a successful
transaction that did not explicitly link to an existing customer profile.

x-enum-elements.name: TERMINAL
x-enum-elements.description: Customer profile created through Square's Virtual Terminal.

x-enum-elements.name: THIRD_PARTY
x-enum-elements.description: Customer profile created through a Square API call.

x-enum-elements.name: THIRD_PARTY_IMPORT
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile created by a third-party product and imported
through an official integration.

x-enum-elements.name: UNMERGE_RECOVERY
x-enum-elements.description:
Customer profile restored through Square's unmerge recovery
process.

CustomerCreationSource.description: Indicates the method used to create the customer profile.

x-enum-elements.name: INCLUDE
x-enum-elements.description:
Customers should be included in the result set when they match the
filtering criteria.

x-enum-elements.name: EXCLUDE
x-enum-elements.description:
Customers should be excluded from the result set when they match
the filtering criteria.

CustomerInclusionExclusion.description:
Indicates whether customers should be included in, or excluded from,
the result set when they match the filtering criteria.

x-enum-elements.name: DEFAULT
x-enum-elements.description:
Use the default sort key. By default, customers are sorted
alphanumerically by concatenating their `given_name` and `family_name`. If
neither name field is set, string comparison is performed using one of the
remaining fields in the following order: `company_name`, `email`,
`phone_number`.

x-enum-elements.name: CREATED_AT
x-enum-elements.description: Use the creation date attribute (`created_at`) of customer profiles as the sort key.

CustomerSortField.description: Specifies customer attributes as the sort key to customer profiles returned from a search.

DayOfWeek.description: Indicates the specific day  of the week.

x-enum-elements.name: UNPAIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The device code is just created and unpaired.

x-enum-elements.name: PAIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The device code has been signed in and paired to a device.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_EVIDENCE
x-enum-elements.description:
Square assumes this evidence type if you don't provide a type when uploading evidence.

Use when uploading evidence as: file or string

x-enum-elements.name: ONLINE_OR_APP_ACCESS_LOG
x-enum-elements.description:
Server or activity logs that show proof of the cardholders identity and that the cardholder successfully ordered and received the goods (digitally or otherwise).
Example evidence: IP addresses, corresponding timestamps/dates, cardholders name/email address linked to a cardholder profile held by Merchant, proof the same device and card (used in dispute) were previously used in prior undisputed transaction, any related detailed activity.

Use when uploading evidence as: file or string

x-enum-elements.name: AUTHORIZATION_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that the cardholder did provide authorization of the charge.
Example evidence: a signed credit card authorization.

Use when uploading evidence as: file

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELLATION_OR_REFUND_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that the cardholder acknowledged your refund or cancellation policy.
Example evidence: a signature or checkbox showing the cardholders acknowledgement of your refund or cancellation policy.

Use when uploading evidence as: file or string

x-enum-elements.name: CARDHOLDER_COMMUNICATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows relevant communication with the cardholder.
Example evidence: emails or texts that show the cardholder received goods/services or demonstrate cardholder satisfaction.

Use when uploading evidence as: file

x-enum-elements.name: CARDHOLDER_INFORMATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that validates customer identity.
Example evidence: personally identifiable details such as name, email address, purchaser IP address, copy of cardholder ID.

Use when uploading evidence as: file or string

x-enum-elements.name: PURCHASE_ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows proof of the sale/transaction.
Example evidence: an invoice, contract, etc. showing the customers acknowledgement of the purchase and your terms.

Use when uploading evidence as: file or string

x-enum-elements.name: DUPLICATE_CHARGE_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows the charge(s) in question are valid and distinct from one another.
Example evidence: receipts, shipping labels, and invoices along with their distinct payment IDs.

Use when uploading evidence as: file

x-enum-elements.name: PRODUCT_OR_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION
x-enum-elements.description:
A description of the product or service sold.

Use when uploading evidence as: file or string

x-enum-elements.name: RECEIPT
x-enum-elements.description:
A receipt or message sent to the cardholder detailing the charge.
Note: You dont need to upload the Square receipt; Square submits the receipt on your behalf.

Use when uploading evidence as: file or string

x-enum-elements.name: SERVICE_RECEIVED_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that the service was provided to the cardholder or the expected date that services will be rendered.
Example evidence: signed delivery form, work order, expected delivery date, or other written agreement.

Use when uploading evidence as: file or string

x-enum-elements.name: PROOF_OF_DELIVERY_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows the product was provided to the cardholder or the expected date of delivery.
Example evidence: signed delivery form, or written agreement acknowledging receipt of goods or services.

Use when uploading evidence as: file or string

x-enum-elements.name: RELATED_TRANSACTION_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows the cardholder previously processed transactions on the same card and did not dispute them.
Note: Square will automatically provide up to 5 distinct Square receipts for related transactions, when available.

Use when uploading evidence as: file or string

x-enum-elements.name: REBUTTAL_EXPLANATION
x-enum-elements.description:
An explanation of why the cardholders claim is invalid.
Example evidence: explanation of why each distinct charge is a legitimate purchase why the cardholders claim for credit owed due to their attempt to cancel, return,
or refund is invalid per your stated policy and cardholder agreement,
or an explanation of how the cardholder did not attempt to remedy the issue with you first in order to receive credit.

Use when uploading evidence as: file or string

x-enum-elements.name: TRACKING_NUMBER
x-enum-elements.description:
The tracking number for the order provided by the shipping carrier. If you have multiple numbers, they will need to be submitted individually as separate pieces of evidence.

Use when uploading evidence as: string

x-enum-elements.name: AMOUNT_DIFFERS
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they were charged the wrong amount for the purchase.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that the cardholder agreed to the amount charged.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELLED
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they attempted to return the goods or cancel the service.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence to prove that the cardholder is not due a refund, and that the cardholder acknowledged your cancellation policy.

x-enum-elements.name: DUPLICATE
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they were charged twice for the same purchase.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that shows both charges are legitimate and independent of one another.

x-enum-elements.name: NO_KNOWLEDGE
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they did not make this purchase nor authorized the charge.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that proves that the cardholder identity was verified at the time of purchase and that the purchase was authorized.

x-enum-elements.name: NOT_AS_DESCRIBED
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims the product or service was provided but the quality of the deliverable did not align with the expectations of the cardholder based on the description.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that shows the cardholder is in possession of the product as described, or received the service as described (agreed) upon.

x-enum-elements.name: NOT_RECEIVED
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims the product or service was not received by the cardholder within the stated time frame.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence to prove that the cardholder is in possession of or received the product or service sold.

x-enum-elements.name: PAID_BY_OTHER_MEANS
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they previously paid for this purchase.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that shows both charges are legitimate and independent of one another or proof that you already provided a credit for the charge.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOMER_REQUESTS_CREDIT
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that the purchase was either cancelled or returned but they have not yet received the credit.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence to prove that the cardholder is not due a refund, and that they acknowledged your cancellation and/or refund policy.

x-enum-elements.name: EMV_LIABILITY_SHIFT
x-enum-elements.description:
A chip-enabled card was not processed through a compliant chip-card reader (e.g. it was swiped instead of dipped into a chip-card reader).
You cannot challenge this dispute because the payment didnt comply with EMV security requirements. For more information, see [What Is EMV.](https://squareup.com/emv)

DisputeReason.description:
List of possible reasons why a cardholder might initiate a
dispute with their bank.

x-enum-elements.name: UNINDEXED
x-enum-elements.description: Item is not synced with Ecom (Weebly). This is the default state

x-enum-elements.name: UNAVAILABLE
x-enum-elements.description: Item is synced but is unavailable within Ecom (Weebly) and Online Checkout

x-enum-elements.name: HIDDEN
x-enum-elements.description: Option for seller to choose manually created Quick Amounts.

x-enum-elements.name: VISIBLE
x-enum-elements.description: Item is synced but available within Ecom (Weebly) and Online Checkout but is hidden from Ecom Store.

EcomVisibility.description: Determines item visibility in Ecom (Online Store) and Online Checkout.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: Specifies that the employee is in the Active state.

x-enum-elements.name: INACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: Specifies that the employee is in the Inactive state.

EmployeeStatus.description: The status of the Employee being retrieved.

x-enum-elements.name: API_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description: An error occurred with the Connect API itself.

x-enum-elements.name: AUTHENTICATION_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description:
An authentication error occurred. Most commonly, the request had
a missing, malformed, or otherwise invalid `Authorization` header.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_REQUEST_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description:
The request was invalid. Most commonly, a required parameter was
missing, or a provided parameter had an invalid value.

x-enum-elements.name: RATE_LIMIT_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description:
Your application reached the Connect API rate limit. Retry your
request after a while.

x-enum-elements.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description:
An error occurred while processing a payment method. Most commonly,
the details of the payment method were invalid (such as a card's CVV
or expiration date).

x-enum-elements.name: REFUND_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description: An error occurred while attempting to process a refund.

ErrorCategory.description:
Indicates which high-level category of error has occurred during a
request to the Connect API.

x-enum-elements.name: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description: 500 Internal Server Error - a general server error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: UNAUTHORIZED
x-enum-elements.description: 401 Unauthorized - a general authorization error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRED
x-enum-elements.description: 401 Unauthorized - the provided access token has expired.

x-enum-elements.name: ACCESS_TOKEN_REVOKED
x-enum-elements.description: 401 Unauthorized - the provided access token has been revoked.

x-enum-elements.name: CLIENT_DISABLED
x-enum-elements.description: 401 Unauthorized - the provided client has been disabled.

x-enum-elements.name: FORBIDDEN
x-enum-elements.description: 403 Forbidden - a general access error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: INSUFFICIENT_SCOPES
x-enum-elements.description:
403 Forbidden - the provided access token does not have permission
to execute the requested action.

x-enum-elements.name: APPLICATION_DISABLED
x-enum-elements.description: 403 Forbidden - the calling application was disabled.

x-enum-elements.name: V1_APPLICATION
x-enum-elements.description:
403 Forbidden - the calling application was created prior to
2016-03-30 and is not compatible with v2 Square API calls.

x-enum-elements.name: V1_ACCESS_TOKEN
x-enum-elements.description:
403 Forbidden - the calling application is using an access token
created prior to 2016-03-30 and is not compatible with v2 Square API
calls.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_PROCESSING_NOT_ENABLED
x-enum-elements.description:
403 Forbidden - the location provided in the API call is not
enabled for credit card processing.

x-enum-elements.name: BAD_REQUEST
x-enum-elements.description: 400 Bad Request - a general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: MISSING_REQUIRED_PARAMETER
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the request is missing a required path, query, or
body parameter.

x-enum-elements.name: INCORRECT_TYPE
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the value provided in the request is the wrong
type. For example, a string instead of an integer.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_TIME
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - formatting for the provided time value is
incorrect.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_TIME_RANGE
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the time range provided in the request is invalid.
For example, the end time is before the start time.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_VALUE
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the provided value is invalid. For example,
including `%` in a phone number.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_CURSOR
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the pagination cursor included in the request is
invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN_QUERY_PARAMETER
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the query parameters provided is invalid for the
requested endpoint.

x-enum-elements.name: CONFLICTING_PARAMETERS
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - 1 or more of the request parameters conflict with
each other.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_JSON_BODY
x-enum-elements.description: 400 Bad Request - the request body is not a JSON object.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_SORT_ORDER
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the provided sort order is not a valid key.
Currently, sort order must be `ASC` or `DESC`.

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_REGEX_MISMATCH
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the provided value does not match an expected
regular expression.

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_TOO_SHORT
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the provided string value is shorter than the
minimum length allowed.

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_TOO_LONG
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the provided string value is longer than the
maximum length allowed.

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_TOO_LOW
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the provided value is less than the supported
minimum.

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_TOO_HIGH
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the provided value is greater than the supported
maximum.

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_EMPTY
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the provided value has a default (empty) value
such as a blank string.

x-enum-elements.name: ARRAY_LENGTH_TOO_LONG
x-enum-elements.description: 400 Bad Request - the provided array has too many elements.

x-enum-elements.name: ARRAY_LENGTH_TOO_SHORT
x-enum-elements.description: 400 Bad Request - the provided array has too few elements.

x-enum-elements.name: ARRAY_EMPTY
x-enum-elements.description: 400 Bad Request - the provided array is empty.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_BOOLEAN
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the endpoint expected the provided value to be a
boolean.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_INTEGER
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the endpoint expected the provided value to be an
integer.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_FLOAT
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the endpoint expected the provided value to be a
float.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_STRING
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the endpoint expected the provided value to be a
string.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_OBJECT
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the endpoint expected the provided value to be a
JSON object.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_ARRAY
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the endpoint expected the provided value to be an
array or list.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_MAP
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the endpoint expected the provided value to be a
map or associative array.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_BASE64_ENCODED_BYTE_ARRAY
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the endpoint expected the provided value to be an
array encoded in base64.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_ARRAY_VALUE
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - 1 or more object in the array does not match the
array type.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_ENUM_VALUE
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - the provided static string is not valid for the
field.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_CONTENT_TYPE
x-enum-elements.description: 400 Bad Request - invalid content type header.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_FORM_VALUE
x-enum-elements.description:
400 Bad Request - Only relevant for applications created prior to
2016-03-30. Indicates there was an error while parsing form values.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOMER_NOT_FOUND
x-enum-elements.description: 400 Bad Request - the provided customer id can't be found in the merchant's customers list.

x-enum-elements.name: ONE_INSTRUMENT_EXPECTED
x-enum-elements.description: 400 Bad Request - a general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: NO_FIELDS_SET
x-enum-elements.description: 400 Bad Request - a general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: TOO_MANY_MAP_ENTRIES
x-enum-elements.description: 400 Bad Request - too many entries in the map field.

x-enum-elements.name: MAP_KEY_LENGTH_TOO_SHORT
x-enum-elements.description: 400 Bad Request - the length of one of the provided keys in the map is too short.

x-enum-elements.name: MAP_KEY_LENGTH_TOO_LONG
x-enum-elements.description: 400 Bad Request - the length of one of the provided keys in the map is too long.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_EXPIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the card is expired.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_EXPIRATION
x-enum-elements.description:
The expiration date for the payment card is invalid. For example,
it indicates a date in the past.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_EXPIRATION_YEAR
x-enum-elements.description:
The expiration year for the payment card is invalid. For example,
it indicates a year in the past or contains invalid characters.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_EXPIRATION_DATE
x-enum-elements.description:
The expiration date for the payment card is invalid. For example,
it contains invalid characters.

x-enum-elements.name: UNSUPPORTED_CARD_BRAND
x-enum-elements.description: The credit card provided is not from a supported issuer.

x-enum-elements.name: UNSUPPORTED_ENTRY_METHOD
x-enum-elements.description: The entry method for the credit card (swipe, dip, tap) is not supported.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_ENCRYPTED_CARD
x-enum-elements.description: The encrypted card information is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_CARD
x-enum-elements.description: The credit card cannot be validated based on the provided details.

x-enum-elements.name: CVV_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the CVV value is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: ADDRESS_VERIFICATION_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the postal code is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_ACCOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer was not able to locate account on record.

x-enum-elements.name: CURRENCY_MISMATCH
x-enum-elements.description:
The currency associated with the payment is not valid for the provided
funding source. For example, a gift card funded in USD cannot be used to process
payments in GBP.

x-enum-elements.name: INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS
x-enum-elements.description: The funding source has insufficient funds to cover the payment.

x-enum-elements.name: INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS
x-enum-elements.description:
The Square account does not have the permissions to accept
this payment. For example, Square may limit which merchants are
allowed to receive gift card payments.

x-enum-elements.name: CARDHOLDER_INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS
x-enum-elements.description:
The card issuer has declined the transaction due to restrictions on where the card can be used.
For example, a gift card is limited to a single merchant.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_LOCATION
x-enum-elements.description:
The Square account cannot take payments in the specified region.
A Square account can take payments only from the region where the account was created.

x-enum-elements.name: TRANSACTION_LIMIT
x-enum-elements.description:
The card issuer has determined the payment amount is either too high or too low.
The API returns the error code mostly for credit cards (for example, the card reached
the credit limit). However, sometimes the issuer bank can indicate the error for debit
or prepaid cards (for example, card has insufficient funds).

x-enum-elements.name: VOICE_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the issuer requires voice authorization from the cardholder.

x-enum-elements.name: PAN_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description:
The specified card number is invalid. For example, it is of
incorrect length or is incorrectly formatted.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPIRATION_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description:
The card expiration date is either invalid or indicates that the
card is expired.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_NOT_SUPPORTED
x-enum-elements.description:
The card is not supported either in the geographic region or by
the MCC [merchant category code](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/docs/api/connect/v2#navsection-connectapibasics)

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_PIN
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the PIN is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_POSTAL_CODE
x-enum-elements.description: The postal code is incorrectly formatted.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_FEES
x-enum-elements.description: The app_fee_money on a payment is too high.

x-enum-elements.name: MANUALLY_ENTERED_PAYMENT_NOT_SUPPORTED
x-enum-elements.description: The card must be swiped, tapped, or dipped. Payments attempted by manually entering the card number are declined.

x-enum-elements.name: PAYMENT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED
x-enum-elements.description: Square declined the request because the payment amount exceeded the processing limit for this merchant.

x-enum-elements.name: GIFT_CARD_AVAILABLE_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description:
When using a gift card as a payment source in a `CreatePayment` request, you can allow
taking partial payment by adding the `accept_partial_authorization` parameter in the request.
If the gift card does not have sufficient balance to pay the entire `amount_money` specified
in the request, the request will succeed (an APPROVED payment for the remaining balance will be
returned). For more information, see [Partial amount with Square gift cards](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/docs/payments-api/take-payments#partial-payment-gift-card).


However, taking such a partial payment does not work if your request also includes `tip_money`,
`app_fee_money`, or both. Square declines such payment and returns this error.
* The error
details provide the amount that was available on the gift card at the time of the request.
The amount is a string representation in the smallest denomination of the applicable currency.
For example, in USD the amount is specified in cents.
* The error code appears in an array
along with the INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS error.

The following is an example set of
errors:
```
{
  "errors": [
    {
  "code": "INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS",
      "detail": "Gift card does not have sufficient balance for requested amount and tip.",
      "category": "PAYMENT_METHOD_ERROR"
    },
    {
      "code": "GIFT_CARD_AVAILABLE_AMOUNT",
      "detail": "4494",
      "category": "PAYMENT_METHOD_ERROR"
    }
  ]
}
```


In addition to the errors, it shows the gift card balance at 44.94 USD. You can review this amount and submit a new `CreatePayment` request with `tip_money` and `amount_money` that fit within the available balance.

x-enum-elements.name: LEAST_EXPENSIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The least expensive matched products are excluded from the pricing. If
the pricing rule is set to exclude one product and multiple products in the
match set qualify as least expensive, then one will be excluded at random.

Excluding the least expensive product gives the best discount value to the buyer.

x-enum-elements.name: MOST_EXPENSIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The most expensive matched product is excluded from the pricing rule.
If multiple products have the same price and all qualify as least expensive,
one will be excluded at random.

This guarantees that the most expensive product is purchased at full price.

ExcludeStrategy.description:
Indicates which products matched by a CatalogPricingRule
will be excluded if the pricing rule uses an exclude set.

x-enum-elements.name: NONE
x-enum-elements.description: The variation does not display an alert.

x-enum-elements.name: LOW_QUANTITY
x-enum-elements.description: The variation generates an alert when its quantity is low.

InventoryAlertType.description: Indicates whether Square should alert the merchant when the inventory quantity of a CatalogItemVariation is low.

x-enum-elements.name: PHYSICAL_COUNT
x-enum-elements.description: The change occurred as part of a physical count update.

x-enum-elements.name: ADJUSTMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
The change occurred as part of the normal lifecycle of goods
(e.g., as an inventory adjustment).

x-enum-elements.name: TRANSFER
x-enum-elements.description: The change occurred as part of an inventory transfer.

InventoryChangeType.description: Indicates how the inventory change was applied to a tracked quantity of items.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOM
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items are in a custom state. **READ-ONLY**:
the Inventory API cannot move quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: IN_STOCK
x-enum-elements.description: The related quantity of items are on hand and available for sale.

x-enum-elements.name: SOLD
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were sold as part of an itemized
transaction. Quantities in the `SOLD` state are no longer tracked.

x-enum-elements.name: RETURNED_BY_CUSTOMER
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were returned through the Square Point
of Sale application, but are not yet available for sale. **READ-ONLY**:
the Inventory API cannot move quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: RESERVED_FOR_SALE
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items are on hand, but not currently
available for sale. **READ-ONLY**: the Inventory API cannot move
quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: SOLD_ONLINE
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were sold online. **READ-ONLY**: the
Inventory API cannot move quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: ORDERED_FROM_VENDOR
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were ordered from a vendor but not yet
received. **READ-ONLY**: the Inventory API cannot move quantities to or
from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: RECEIVED_FROM_VENDOR
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were received from a vendor but are
not yet available for sale. **READ-ONLY**: the Inventory API cannot move
quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: IN_TRANSIT_TO
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items are in transit between locations.
*READ-ONLY**: the Inventory API cannot move quantities to or from this
state.

x-enum-elements.name: NONE
x-enum-elements.description:
A placeholder indicating that the related quantity of items are not
currently tracked in Square. Transferring quantities from the `NONE` state
to a tracked state (e.g., `IN_STOCK`) introduces stock into the system.

x-enum-elements.name: WASTE
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items are lost or damaged and cannot be
sold.

x-enum-elements.name: UNLINKED_RETURN
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were returned but not linked to a
previous transaction. Unlinked returns are not tracked in Square.
Transferring a quantity from `UNLINKED_RETURN` to a tracked state (e.g.,
`IN_STOCK`) introduces new stock into the system.

InventoryState.description: Indicates the state of a tracked item quantity in the lifecycle of goods.

x-enum-elements.name: PENDING
x-enum-elements.description: The reminder is to be sent on the `relative_scheduled_date` (if the invoice is published).

x-enum-elements.name: NOT_APPLICABLE
x-enum-elements.description:
The reminder is not applicable and is not sent. The following are examples
of when reminders are not applicable and are not sent:
- You schedule a reminder to be sent before the invoice is published.
- The invoice is configured with multiple payment requests and a payment request reminder
is configured to be sent after the next payment request `due_date`.
- Two reminders (for different payment requests) are configured to be sent on the
same date. Therefore, only one reminder is sent.
- You configure a reminder to be sent on the date that the invoice is scheduled to be sent.
- The payment request is already paid.
- The invoice status is `CANCELED` or `FAILED`.

InvoicePaymentReminderStatus.description: The status of a payment request reminder.

x-enum-elements.name: EMAIL
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to email the invoice to the customer after the invoice is published 
(either immediately or at the `scheduled_at` time, if specified in the `invoice`.

x-enum-elements.name: CHARGE_CARD_ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to charge the card on file, on the `due_date`, specified in the payment request 
after the invoice is published.

x-enum-elements.name: SHARE_MANUALLY
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to take no specific action on the invoice. In this case, the seller 
(or the application developer) follows up with the customer for payment. For example, 
a seller might collect a payment in the Seller Dashboard or use the Point of Sale (POS) application. 
The seller might also share the URL of the Square-hosted invoice page (`public_url`) with the customer requesting payment.

InvoiceRequestMethod.description:
Specifies the action for Square to take for processing the invoice. For example, 
email the invoice, charge a customer's card on file, or do nothing.

x-enum-elements.name: BALANCE
x-enum-elements.description:
Identifies that the payment request is for the balance amount, after accounting for any 
other payment requests in the invoice: 

- If the invoice specifies only a balance payment request, it refers to the 
total amount identified by the associated order. 
- If the invoice also specifies a deposit request, the balance payment request refers to 
the remaining amount.
- `INSTALLMENT` and `BALANCE` are not allowed together.

x-enum-elements.name: DEPOSIT
x-enum-elements.description:
Identifies that the payment request is for a deposit. You have the option of specifying 
an exact amount or a percentage of the total order amount. If you request a deposit, 
it must be due before any other payment requests.

x-enum-elements.name: INSTALLMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
Identifies that the payment request is for an installment. An invoice can request payments in installments. 
Along with installments, you can request an optional deposit. All these payment requests must add to the total order amount.

InvoiceRequestType.description:
Identifies the type of the payment request. For more information, 
see [Payment request](TBD).

x-enum-elements.name: INVOICE_SORT_DATE
x-enum-elements.description:
The field works as follows:

- If the invoice is a draft, it uses the invoice `created_at` date.
- If the invoice is scheduled for publication, it uses the `scheduled_at` date.
- If the invoice is published, it uses the invoice publication date.

x-enum-elements.name: DRAFT
x-enum-elements.description:
The invoice is a draft. You must publish a draft invoice before Square can process it.
A draft invoice has no public_url, so it is not available to customers.

x-enum-elements.name: UNPAID
x-enum-elements.description: The invoice is published but not yet paid.

x-enum-elements.name: SCHEDULED
x-enum-elements.description:
The invoice is scheduled to be processed. On scheduled date,
Square emails the invoice (if the `request_method` is EMAIL),
charge the customer's card (if `request_method` is CHARGE_CARD_ON_FILE),
or take no action (if the `request_method` is SHARE_MANUALLY).
The invoice status then changes accordingly (`UNPAID`, `PAID`, or `PARTIALLY_PAID`).

x-enum-elements.name: PARTIALLY_PAID
x-enum-elements.description: A partial payment is received for the invoice.

x-enum-elements.name: PAID
x-enum-elements.description: The customer paid the invoice in full.

x-enum-elements.name: PARTIALLY_REFUNDED
x-enum-elements.description:
The invoice is paid (or partially paid) and some but not all the amount paid is
refunded.

x-enum-elements.name: REFUNDED
x-enum-elements.description: The full amount that the customer paid for the invoice is refunded.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description:
The invoice is canceled. Square no longer requests payments from the customer.
The `public_url` page remains and is accessible, but it displays the invoice
as cancelled and does not accept payment.

x-enum-elements.name: FAILED
x-enum-elements.description: Square canceled the invoice due to suspicious activity.

InvoiceStatus.description: Indicates the status of an invoice.

x-enum-elements.name: NONE
x-enum-elements.description: The job does not have a defined pay type.

x-enum-elements.name: HOURLY
x-enum-elements.description: The job pays on an hourly basis.

x-enum-elements.name: SALARY
x-enum-elements.description: The job pays an annual salary.

JobAssignmentPayType.description: Enumerates the possible pay types that a job can be assigned.

x-enum-elements.name: CREDIT_CARD_PROCESSING
x-enum-elements.description:
The permission to process credit card transactions with Square.

The location can process credit cards if this value is present
in the `capabilities` array of the `Location`.

LocationCapability.description: The capabilities a location may have.

x-enum-elements.description: A location that is active for business.

x-enum-elements.name: INACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
A location that is not active for business. Inactive locations just provide historical
information, so typically clients limit interaction with or hide these locations.

LocationStatus.description: The status of the location, whether a location is active or inactive.

x-enum-elements.name: PHYSICAL
x-enum-elements.description: A place of business with a physical location.

x-enum-elements.name: MOBILE
x-enum-elements.description: A place of business that is mobile, such as a food truck or online store.

LocationType.description: A location's physical or mobile type.

x-enum-elements.description: The loyalty account is mapped by phone.

x-enum-elements.description: The event is generated by the Square Point of Sale (POS).

x-enum-elements.name: LOYALTY_API
x-enum-elements.description: The event is generated by something other than the Square Point of Sale that used the Loyalty API.

LoyaltyEventSource.description: Defines whether the event was generated by the Square Point of Sale.

x-enum-elements.name: ACCUMULATE_POINTS
x-enum-elements.description: Points are added to a loyalty account for a purchase.

x-enum-elements.name: CREATE_REWARD
x-enum-elements.description:
A loyalty reward is created. For more information, see  
[Loyalty rewards](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/docs/loyalty-api/overview/#loyalty-overview-loyalty-rewards).

x-enum-elements.name: EXPIRE_POINTS
x-enum-elements.description:
Loyalty points are expired according to the

LoyaltyEventType.description: The type of the loyalty event.

x-enum-elements.name: VISIT
x-enum-elements.description:
A visit-based accrual rule. A buyer earns points for each visit. 
You can specify the minimum purchase required.

x-enum-elements.name: SPEND
x-enum-elements.description:
A spend-based accrual rule. A buyer earns points based on the amount 
spent.

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM_VARIATION
x-enum-elements.description:
An accrual rule based on an item variation. For example, accrue 
points for purchasing a coffee.

x-enum-elements.name: CATEGORY
x-enum-elements.description:
An accrual rule based on an item category. For example, accrue points 
for purchasing any item in the "hot drink" category: coffee, tea, or hot cocoa.

LoyaltyProgramAccrualRuleType.description: The type of the accrual rule that defines how buyers can earn points.

x-enum-elements.name: ORDER
x-enum-elements.description: The discount applies to the entire order.

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM_VARIATION
x-enum-elements.description: The discount applies only to specific item variations.

x-enum-elements.name: CATEGORY
x-enum-elements.description: The discount applies only to items in the given categories.

LoyaltyProgramRewardDefinitionScope.description: Indicates the scope of the reward tier.

LoyaltyProgramRewardDefinitionType.description: The type of discount the reward tier offers.

x-enum-elements.name: INACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The loyalty program does not have an active subscription. 
Loyalty API requests fail.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: The program is fully functional. The program has an active subscription.

LoyaltyProgramStatus.description: Whether the program is currently active.

LoyaltyRewardStatus.description: The status of the loyalty reward.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER_DISCOUNT_SCOPE
x-enum-elements.description:
Used for reporting only.
The original transaction discount scope is currently not supported by the API.

x-enum-elements.name: LINE_ITEM
x-enum-elements.description:
The discount should be applied to only line items specified by
`OrderLineItemAppliedDiscount` reference records.

x-enum-elements.name: ORDER
x-enum-elements.description: The discount should be applied to the entire order.

OrderLineItemDiscountScope.description: Indicates whether this is a line item or order level discount.

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN_DISCOUNT
x-enum-elements.description:
Used for reporting only.
The original transaction discount type is currently not supported by the API.

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_PERCENTAGE
x-enum-elements.description: Apply the discount as a fixed percentage (e.g., 5%) off the item price.

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: Apply the discount as a fixed monetary value (e.g., $1.00) off the item price.

x-enum-elements.name: VARIABLE_PERCENTAGE
x-enum-elements.description:
Apply the discount as a variable percentage based on the item
price.

The specific discount percentage of a `VARIABLE_PERCENTAGE` discount
is assigned at the time of the purchase.

x-enum-elements.name: VARIABLE_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description:
Apply the discount as a variable amount based on the item price.

The specific discount amount of a `VARIABLE_AMOUNT` discount
is assigned at the time of the purchase.

OrderLineItemDiscountType.description: Indicates how the discount is applied to the associated line item or order.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER_TAX_SCOPE
x-enum-elements.description:
Used for reporting only.
The original transaction tax scope is currently not supported by the API.

x-enum-elements.name: LINE_ITEM
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax should be applied only to line items specified by
the `OrderLineItemAppliedTax` reference records.

x-enum-elements.name: ORDER
x-enum-elements.description: The tax should be applied to the entire order.

OrderLineItemTaxScope.description: Indicates whether this is a line item or order level tax.

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN_TAX
x-enum-elements.description:
Used for reporting only.
The original transaction tax type is currently not supported by the API.

x-enum-elements.name: ADDITIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax is an additive tax. The tax amount is added on top of the price.
For example, an item with a cost of 1.00 USD and a 10% additive tax would have a total
cost to the buyer of 1.10 USD.

x-enum-elements.name: INCLUSIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax is an inclusive tax. Inclusive taxes are already included
in the line item price or order total. For example, an item with cost
1.00 USD with a 10% inclusive tax would have a pre-tax cost of 0.91 USD
(91 cents) and a 0.09 (9 cents) tax for a total cost of 1.00 USD to
the buyer.

OrderLineItemTaxType.description: Indicates how the tax is applied to the associated line item or order.

x-enum-elements.name: SUBTOTAL_PHASE
x-enum-elements.description:
The service charge will be applied after discounts, but before
taxes.

x-enum-elements.name: TOTAL_PHASE
x-enum-elements.description:
The service charge will be applied after all discounts and taxes
are applied.

OrderServiceChargeCalculationPhase.description:
Represents a phase in the process of calculating order totals.
Service charges are applied __after__ the indicated phase.

[Read more about how order totals are calculated.](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/docs/orders-api/how-it-works#how-totals-are-calculated)

x-enum-elements.name: OPEN
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates the order is open. Open orders may be updated.

x-enum-elements.name: COMPLETED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates the order is completed. Completed orders are fully paid. This is a terminal state.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates the order is canceled. Canceled orders are not paid. This is a terminal state.

x-enum-elements.name: EXTERNAL_API

x-enum-elements.name: ADDITIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax is an additive tax. The tax amount is added on top of the
CatalogItemVariation price. For example, a $1.00 item with a 10% additive
tax would have a total cost to the buyer of $1.10.

x-enum-elements.name: INCLUSIVE

The tax is an inclusive tax. The tax amount is included in the

location_id.description: The location ID for a recipient (other than the merchant) receiving a portion of this tender.

receivable_id.description: The unique ID for this `AdditionalRecipientReceivable`, assigned by the server.

address_line_1.description:
The first line of the address.

Fields that start with `address_line` provide the address's most specific
details, like street number, street name, and building name. They do *not*
provide less specific details like city, state/province, or country (these
details are provided in other fields).

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address, if any.

address_line_3.description: The third line of the address, if any.

locality.description: The city or town of the address.

sublocality.description: A civil region within the address's `locality`, if any.

sublocality_2.description: A civil region within the address's `sublocality`, if any.

sublocality_3.description: A civil region within the address's `sublocality_2`, if any.

administrative_district_level_1.description:
A civil entity within the address's country. In the US, this
is the state.

administrative_district_level_2.description:
A civil entity within the address's `administrative_district_level_1`.
In the US, this is the county.

administrative_district_level_3.description:
A civil entity within the address's `administrative_district_level_2`,
if any.

country.description:
The address's country, in ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 format.

first_name.description: Optional first name when it's representing recipient.

last_name.description: Optional last name when it's representing recipient.

organization.description: Optional organization name when it's representing recipient.

Secondary identifier for the bank. For more information, see

Reference identifier that will be displayed to UK bank account owners

Client-provided identifier for linking the banking account to an entity

Read-only. The current verification status of this BankAccount object.

creditable.description: Indicates whether it is possible for Square to send money to this bank account.

debitable.description:
Indicates whether it is possible for Square to take money from this

entries and determine if the they represent the same real-world bank account.

bank_name.description:
Read only. Name of actual financial institution.

Represents a bank account. For more information about 
linking a bank account to a Square account, see 
[Bank Accounts API](/docs/bank-accounts-api).

idempotency_key.description:
A client-supplied, universally unique identifier (UUID) for the
request.

[API Development 101](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/basics/api101/overview) section for more
information.

changes.description:
The set of physical counts and inventory adjustments to be made.
Changes are applied based on the client-supplied timestamp and may be sent
out of order.

ignore_unchanged_counts.description:
Indicates whether the current physical count should be ignored if
the quantity is unchanged since the last physical count. Default: `true`.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

counts.description: The current counts for all objects referenced in the request.

object_ids.description:
The IDs of the CatalogObjects to be deleted. When an object is deleted, other objects
in the graph that depend on that object will be deleted as well (for example, deleting a
CatalogItem will delete its CatalogItemVariation.

errors.description: The set of Errors encountered.

deleted_object_ids.description: The IDs of all CatalogObjects deleted by this request.

deleted_at.description: The database [timestamp](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-dates) of this deletion in RFC 3339 format, e.g., "2016-09-04T23:59:33.123Z".

object_ids.description: The IDs of the CatalogObjects to be retrieved.

include_related_objects.description:
If `true`, the response will include additional objects that are related to the
requested objects, as follows:

If the `objects` field of the response contains a CatalogItem, its associated
CatalogCategory objects, CatalogTax objects, CatalogImage objects and
CatalogModifierLists will be returned in the `related_objects` field of the
response. If the `objects` field of the response contains a CatalogItemVariation,
its parent CatalogItem will be returned in the `related_objects` field of
the response.

errors.description: The set of `Error`s encountered.

related_objects.description: A list of `CatalogObject`s referenced by the object in the `objects` field.

catalog_object_ids.description:
The filter to return results by `CatalogObject` ID.
The filter is only applicable when set. The default value is null.

location_ids.description:
The filter to return results by `Location` ID. 
The filter is only applicable when set. The default value is null.

types.description:
The filter to return results by `InventoryChangeType` values other than `TRANSFER`.
The default value is `[PHYSICAL_COUNT, ADJUSTMENT]`.
See [InventoryChangeType](#type-inventorychangetype) for possible values

states.description:
The filter to return `ADJUSTMENT` query results by
`InventoryState`. This filter is only applied when set.
The default value is null.
See [InventoryState](#type-inventorystate) for possible values

updated_after.description:
The filter to return results with their `calculated_at` value  
after the given time as specified in an RFC 3339 timestamp. 
The default value is the UNIX epoch of (`1970-01-01T00:00:00Z`).

updated_before.description:
The filter to return results with their `created_at` or `calculated_at` value  
strictly before the given time as specified in an RFC 3339 timestamp. 
The default value is the UNIX epoch of (`1970-01-01T00:00:00Z`).

cursor.description:

See the [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/working-with-apis/pagination) guide for more information.

location_id.description:
The ID of the location for these orders. This field is optional: omit it to retrieve
orders within the scope of the current authorization's merchant ID.

order_ids.description: The IDs of the orders to retrieve. A maximum of 100 orders can be retrieved per request.

BatchRetrieveOrdersRequest.description:
Defines the fields that are included in requests to the
BatchRetrieveOrders endpoint.

orders.description: The requested orders. This will omit any requested orders that do not exist.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

BatchRetrieveOrdersResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the BatchRetrieveOrders endpoint.

idempotency_key.description:
A value you specify that uniquely identifies this
request among all your requests. A common way to create
a valid idempotency key is to use a Universally unique
identifier (UUID).

If you're unsure whether a particular request was successful,
you can reattempt it with the same idempotency key without
worrying about creating duplicate objects.

See [Idempotency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/basics/api101/idempotency) for more information.

batches.description:
A batch of CatalogObjects to be inserted/updated atomically.
The objects within a batch will be inserted in an all-or-nothing fashion, i.e., if an error occurs
attempting to insert or update an object within a batch, the entire batch will be rejected. However, an error
in one batch will not affect other batches within the same request.

For each object, its `updated_at` field is ignored and replaced with a current [timestamp](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-dates), and its
`is_deleted` field must not be set to `true`.

To modify an existing object, supply its ID. To create a new object, use an ID starting
with `#`. These IDs may be used to create relationships between an object and attributes of
other objects that reference it. For example, you can create a CatalogItem with
ID `#ABC` and a CatalogItemVariation with its `item_id` attribute set to
`#ABC` in order to associate the CatalogItemVariation with its parent
CatalogItem.

Any `#`-prefixed IDs are valid only within a single atomic batch, and will be replaced by server-generated IDs.

Each batch may contain up to 1,000 objects. The total number of objects across all batches for a single request
may not exceed 10,000. If either of these limits is violated, an error will be returned and no objects will
be inserted or updated.

errors.description: Information on any errors that encountered.

updated_at.description: The database [timestamp](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-dates) of this update in RFC 3339 format, e.g., "2016-09-04T23:59:33.123Z".

id_mappings.description: The mapping between client and server IDs for this upsert.

start_at.description:
RFC 3339; follows same timezone info as `Shift`. Precision up to
the minute is respected; seconds are truncated.

end_at.description:
RFC 3339; follows same timezone info as `Shift`. Precision up to
the minute is respected; seconds are truncated.

name.description: A human-readable name.

expected_duration.description:
Format: RFC-3339 P[n]Y[n]M[n]DT[n]H[n]M[n]S. The expected length of
the break.

is_paid.description:
Whether this break counts towards time worked for compensation
purposes.

Break.description: A record of an employee's break during a shift.

location_id.description: The ID of the business location this type of break applies to.

break_name.description:
A human-readable name for this type of break. Will be displayed to
employees in Square products.

expected_duration.description:
Format: RFC-3339 P[n]Y[n]M[n]DT[n]H[n]M[n]S. The expected length of
this break. Precision below minutes is truncated.

is_paid.description:
Whether this break counts towards time worked for compensation
purposes.

version.description:
Used for resolving concurrency issues; request will fail if version
provided does not match server version at time of request. If a value is not
provided, Square's servers execute a "blind" write; potentially
overwriting another writer's data.

created_at.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

updated_at.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

BreakType.description:
A defined break template that sets an expectation for possible `Break`
instances on a `Shift`.

team_members.description: The data which will be used to create the `TeamMember` objects. Each key is the `idempotency_key` that maps to the `CreateTeamMemberRequest`.

BulkCreateTeamMembersRequest.description: Represents a bulk create request for `TeamMember` objects.

team_members.description: The successfully created `TeamMember` objects. Each key is the `idempotency_key` that maps to the `CreateTeamMemberRequest`.

errors.description: The errors that occurred during the request.

BulkCreateTeamMembersResponse.description: Represents a response from a bulk create request, containing the created `TeamMember` objects or error messages.

team_members.description: The data which will be used to update the `TeamMember` objects. Each key is the `team_member_id` that maps to the `UpdateTeamMemberRequest`.

BulkUpdateTeamMembersRequest.description: Represents a bulk update request for `TeamMember` objects.

team_members.description: The successfully updated `TeamMember` objects. Each key is the `team_member_id` that maps to the `UpdateTeamMemberRequest`.

errors.description: The errors that occurred during the request.

BulkUpdateTeamMembersResponse.description: Represents a response from a bulk update request, containing the updated `TeamMember` objects or error messages.

periods.description:
The list of time periods during which the business is open. There may be at most 10
periods per day.

BusinessHours.description: Represents the hours of operation for a business location.

day_of_week.description:
The day of week for this time period.
See [DayOfWeek](#type-dayofweek) for possible values

start_local_time.description:
The start time of a business hours period, specified in local time using partial-time
RFC3339 format.

end_local_time.description:
The end time of a business hours period, specified in local time using partial-time
RFC3339 format.

BusinessHoursPeriod.description: Represents a period of time during which a business location is open.

order_id.description:
The `order` ID for which to calculate the points.
Specify this field if your application uses the Orders API to process orders.
Otherwise, specify the `transaction_amount`.

transaction_amount_money.description:
The purchase amount for which to calculate the points. 
Specify this field if your application does not use the Orders API to process orders.
Otherwise, specify the `order_id`.

CalculateLoyaltyPointsRequest.description:
A request to calculate the points that a buyer can earn from 
a specified purchase.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

points.description: The points that the buyer can earn from a specified purchase.

CalculateLoyaltyPointsResponse.description:
A response that includes the points that the buyer can earn from 
a specified purchase.

order.description: The order to be calculated. Expects the entire order, not a sparse update.

proposed_rewards.description:
Identifies one or more loyalty reward tiers to apply during order calculation.
The discounts defined by the reward tiers are added to the order only to preview the
effect of applying the specified reward(s). The reward(s) do not correspond to actual
redemptions, that is, no `reward`s are created. Therefore, the reward `id`s are
random strings used only to reference the reward tier.

order.description: The calculated version of the order provided in the request.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

version.description:
The version of the `invoice` to cancel.
If you do not know the version, you can call 
`GetInvoice](#endpoint-Invoices-GetInvoice) or [ListInvoices`.

errors.description: Information about errors encountered during the request.

CancelInvoiceResponse.description: The response returned by the `CancelInvoice` request.

idempotency_key.description: `idempotency_key` identifying the payment to be canceled.

CancelPaymentByIdempotencyKeyRequest.description: Specifies idempotency key of a payment to cancel.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

CancelPaymentByIdempotencyKeyResponse.description:
Return value from the
[CancelPaymentByIdempotencyKey](#endpoint-payments-cancelpaymentbyidempotencykey) endpoint.
On success, `errors` will be empty.

CancelPaymentRequest.description:
Cancels (voids) a payment before it has been completed.
Note: only payments created with `autocomplete` set to false can be canceled.

errors.description: Information on errors encountered during the request.

CancelSubscriptionRequest.description:
Defines parameters in a 
[CancelSubscription](#endpoint-subscriptions-cancelsubscription) endpoint request.

errors.description: Information about errors encountered during the request.

CancelSubscriptionResponse.description:
Defines fields that are included in a 
[CancelSubscription](#endpoint-subscriptions-cancelsubscription) response.

errors.description: Information on errors encountered during the request.
Any errors that occurred during the request.

CaptureTransactionResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the [CaptureTransaction](#endpoint-capturetransaction) endpoint.

id.description: Unique ID for this card. Generated by Square.

card_brand.description:
The card's brand.
See [CardBrand](#type-cardbrand) for possible values

last_4.description: The last 4 digits of the card number.

exp_month.description: The expiration month of the associated card as an integer between 1 and 12.

exp_year.description: The four-digit year of the card's expiration date.

billing_address.description: The billing address for this card.

fingerprint.description:
__Not currently set.__ Intended as a Square-assigned identifier, based
on the card number, to identify the card across multiple locations within a
single application.

card_type.description:
The type of the card.
The Card object includes this field only in response to Payments API calls.
See [CardType](#type-cardtype) for possible values

prepaid_type.description:
Indicates whether the Card is prepaid or not.
The Card object includes this field only in response to Payments API calls.
See [CardPrepaidType](#type-cardprepaidtype) for possible values

bin.description:
The first six digits of the card number, known as the Bank Identification Number (BIN). Only the Payments API
returns this field.

Card.description:
Represents the payment details of a card to be used for payments. These
details are determined by the `card_nonce` generated by `SqPaymentForm`.

status.description:
The card payment's current state. It can be one of: `AUTHORIZED`, `CAPTURED`, `VOIDED`,
`FAILED`.

entry_method.description:
The method used to enter the card's details for the payment.  Can be
`KEYED`, `SWIPED`, `EMV`, `ON_FILE`, or `CONTACTLESS`.

cvv_status.description:
Status code returned from the Card Verification Value (CVV) check. Can be
`CVV_ACCEPTED`, `CVV_REJECTED`, `CVV_NOT_CHECKED`.

avs_status.description:
Status code returned from the Address Verification System (AVS) check. Can be
`AVS_ACCEPTED`, `AVS_REJECTED`, `AVS_NOT_CHECKED`.

auth_result_code.description:
Status code returned by the card issuer that describes the payment's
authorization status.

application_identifier.description: For EMV payments, identifies the EMV application used for the payment.

application_name.description: For EMV payments, the human-readable name of the EMV application used for the payment.

application_cryptogram.description: For EMV payments, the cryptogram generated for the payment.

verification_method.description:
For EMV payments, method used to verify the cardholder's identity.  Can be one of
`PIN`, `SIGNATURE`, `PIN_AND_SIGNATURE`, `ON_DEVICE`, or `NONE`.

verification_results.description:
For EMV payments, the results of the cardholder verification.  Can be one of
`SUCCESS`, `FAILURE`, or `UNKNOWN`.

statement_description.description:
The statement description sent to the card networks.

Note: The actual statement description will vary and is likely to be truncated and appended with
additional information on a per issuer basis.

device_details.description: Details about the device that took the payment.

refund_requires_card_presence.description:
Whether or not the card is required to be physically present in order for the payment to
be refunded.  If true, the card is required to be present.

errors.description: Information on errors encountered during the request.

CardPaymentDetails.description: Reflects the current status of a card payment.

name.description: The device merchant-specified name.

state.description:
The shift current state.
See [CashDrawerShiftState](#type-cashdrawershiftstate) for possible values

opened_at.description: The time when the shift began, in ISO 8601 format.

ended_at.description: The time when the shift ended, in ISO 8601 format.

closed_at.description: The time when the shift was closed, in ISO 8601 format.

employee_ids.description:
The IDs of all employees that were logged into Square Point of Sale at any
point while the cash drawer shift was open.

opening_employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that started the cash drawer shift.

ending_employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that ended the cash drawer shift.

closing_employee_id.description:
The ID of the employee that closed the cash drawer shift by auditing
the cash drawer contents.

description.description: The free-form text description of a cash drawer by an employee.

opened_cash_money.description:
The amount of money in the cash drawer at the start of the shift.
The amount must be greater than or equal to zero.

cash_payment_money.description:
The amount of money added to the cash drawer from cash payments.
This is computed by summing all events with the types CASH_TENDER_PAYMENT and
CASH_TENDER_CANCELED_PAYMENT. The amount is always greater than or equal to
zero.

cash_refunds_money.description:
The amount of money removed from the cash drawer from cash refunds.
It is computed by summing the events of type CASH_TENDER_REFUND. The amount
is always greater than or equal to zero.

cash_paid_in_money.description:
The amount of money added to the cash drawer for reasons other than cash
payments. It is computed by summing the events of type PAID_IN. The amount is
always greater than or equal to zero.

cash_paid_out_money.description:
The amount of money removed from the cash drawer for reasons other than
cash refunds. It is computed by summing the events of type PAID_OUT. The amount
is always greater than or equal to zero.

expected_cash_money.description:
The amount of money that should be in the cash drawer at the end of the
shift, based on the shift's other money amounts.
This can be negative if employees have not correctly recorded all the events
on the cash drawer.
cash_paid_out_money is a summation of amounts from cash_payment_money (zero
or positive), cash_refunds_money (zero or negative), cash_paid_in_money (zero
or positive), and cash_paid_out_money (zero or negative) event types.

closed_cash_money.description:
The amount of money found in the cash drawer at the end of the shift
by an auditing employee. The amount should be positive.

device.description: The device running Square Point of Sale that was connected to the cash drawer.

CashDrawerShift.description:
This model gives the details of a cash drawer shift.
The cash_payment_money, cash_refund_money, cash_paid_in_money,
and cash_paid_out_money fields are all computed by summing their respective
event types.

id.description: The unique ID of the event.

employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that created the event.

event_type.description:
The type of cash drawer shift event.
See [CashDrawerEventType](#type-cashdrawereventtype) for possible values

event_money.description:
The amount of money that was added to or removed from the cash drawer
in the event. The amount can be positive (for added money), negative
(for removed money), or zero (for other tender type payments).

created_at.description: The event time in ISO 8601 format.

description.description:
An optional description of the event, entered by the employee that
created the event.

state.description:
The shift current state.
See [CashDrawerShiftState](#type-cashdrawershiftstate) for possible values

opened_at.description: The shift start time in ISO 8601 format.

ended_at.description: The shift end time in ISO 8601 format.

closed_at.description: The shift close time in ISO 8601 format.

description.description: An employee free-text description of a cash drawer shift.

opened_cash_money.description:
The amount of money in the cash drawer at the start of the shift. This
must be a positive amount.

expected_cash_money.description:
The amount of money that should be in the cash drawer at the end of the
shift, based on the cash drawer events on the shift.
The amount is correct if all shift employees accurately recorded their
cash drawer shift events. Unrecorded events and events with the wrong amount
result in an incorrect expected_cash_money amount that can be negative.

closed_cash_money.description:
The amount of money found in the cash drawer at the end of the shift by
an auditing employee. The amount must be greater than or equal to zero.

CashDrawerShiftSummary.description:
The summary of a closed cash drawer shift.
This model contains only the money counted to start a cash drawer shift, counted
at the end of the shift, and the amount that should be in the drawer at shift
end based on summing all cash drawer shift events.

name.description: The category name. This is a searchable attribute for use in applicable query filters, and its value length is of Unicode code points.

CatalogCategory.description: A category to which a `CatalogItem` instance belongs.

type.description:
The type of this custom attribute. Cannot be modified after creation.
Required.
See [CatalogCustomAttributeDefinitionType](#type-catalogcustomattributedefinitiontype) for possible values

name.description:
The name of this definition for API and seller-facing UI purposes.
The name must be unique within the (merchant, application_id) pair. Required.
May not be empty and may not exceed 255 characters. Can be modified after creation.

description.description:
Seller-oriented description of the meaning of this Custom Attribute,
any constraints that the seller should observe, etc. May be displayed as a tooltip in Square UIs.

source_application.description:
__Read only.__ Contains information about the application that
created this custom attribute definition.

allowed_object_types.description:
The set of Catalog Object Types that this Custom Attribute may be applied to.
Currently, only `ITEM` and `ITEM_VARIATION` are allowed. At least one type must be included.
See [CatalogObjectType](#type-catalogobjecttype) for possible values

seller_visibility.description:
The visibility of a custom attribute in seller-facing UIs (including Square Point
of Sale applications and Square Dashboard). May be modified.
See [CatalogCustomAttributeDefinitionSellerVisibility](#type-catalogcustomattributedefinitionsellervisibility) for possible values

app_visibility.description:
The visibility of a custom attribute to applications other than the application
that created the attribute.
See [CatalogCustomAttributeDefinitionAppVisibility](#type-catalogcustomattributedefinitionappvisibility) for possible values

selection_config.description: Populated when `type` is set to `SELECTION`, unset otherwise.

custom_attribute_usage_count.description:
__Read-only.__ The number of custom attributes that reference this
custom attribute definition. Set by the server in response to a ListCatalog
request with `include_counts` set to `true`.  If the actual count is greater
than 100, `custom_attribute_usage_count` will be set to `100`.

key.description:
The name of the desired custom attribute key that can be used to access
the custom attribute value on catalog objects. Cannot be modified after the
custom attribute definition has been created.
Must be between 1 and 60 characters, and may only contain the characters [a-zA-Z0-9_-].

CatalogCustomAttributeDefinition.description:
Contains information defining a custom attribute. Custom attributes are
intended to store additional information about a catalog object or to associate a
catalog object with an entity in another system. Do not use custom attributes
to store any sensitive information (personally identifiable information, card details, etc.).
[Read more about custom attributes](/catalog-api/add-custom-attributes)

precision.description:
An integer between 0 and 5 that represents the maximum number of
positions allowed after the decimal in number custom attribute values
For example:

- if the precision is 0, the quantity can be 1, 2, 3, etc.
- if the precision is 1, the quantity can be 0.1, 0.2, etc.
- if the precision is 2, the quantity can be 0.01, 0.12, etc.

Default: 5

max_allowed_selections.description:
The maximum number of selections that can be set. The maximum value for this
attribute is 100. The default value is 1. The value can be modified, but changing the value will not
affect existing custom attribute values on objects. Clients need to
handle custom attributes with more selected values than allowed by this limit.

allowed_selections.description:
The set of valid `CatalogCustomAttributeSelections`. Up to a maximum of 100
selections can be defined. Can be modified.

CatalogCustomAttributeDefinitionSelectio.description: Configuration associated with `SELECTION`-type custom attribute definitions.

name.description: Selection name, unique within `allowed_selections`.

CatalogCustomAttributeDefinitionSelectio.description: A named selection for this `SELECTION`-type custom attribute definition.

enforce_uniqueness.description:
If true, each Custom Attribute instance associated with this Custom Attribute
Definition must have a unique value within the seller's catalog. For
example, this may be used for a value like a SKU that should not be
duplicated within a seller's catalog. May not be modified after the
definition has been created.

CatalogCustomAttributeDefinitionStringCo.description: Configuration associated with Custom Attribute Definitions of type `STRING`.

name.description: The name of the custom attribute.

string_value.description: The string value of the custom attribute.  Populated if `type` = `STRING`.

custom_attribute_definition_id.description: __Read-only.__ The id of the `CatalogCustomAttributeDefinition` this value belongs to.

type.description:
__Read-only.__ A copy of type from the associated `CatalogCustomAttributeDefinition`.
See [CatalogCustomAttributeDefinitionType](#type-catalogcustomattributedefinitiontype) for possible values

number_value.description:
Populated if `type` = `NUMBER`. Contains a string
representation of a decimal number, using a `.` as the decimal separator.

selection_uid_values.description: One or more choices from `allowed_selections`. Populated if `type` = `SELECTION`.

key.description: __Read-only.__ A copy of key from the associated `CatalogCustomAttributeDefinition`.

CatalogCustomAttributeValue.description:
An instance of a custom attribute. Custom attributes can be defined and
added to `ITEM` and `ITEM_VARIATION` type catalog objects.
[Read more about custom attributes](/catalog-api/add-custom-attributes).

name.description: The discount name. This is a searchable attribute for use in applicable query filters, and its value length is of Unicode code points.

discount_type.description:
Indicates whether the discount is a fixed amount or percentage, or entered at the time of sale.
See [CatalogDiscountType](#type-catalogdiscounttype) for possible values

percentage.description:
The percentage of the discount as a string representation of a decimal number, using a `.` as the decimal
separator and without a `%` sign. A value of `7.5` corresponds to `7.5%`. Specify a percentage of `0` if `discount_type`
is `VARIABLE_PERCENTAGE`.

Do not use this field for amount-based or variable discounts.

amount_money.description:
The amount of the discount. Specify an amount of `0` if `discount_type` is `VARIABLE_AMOUNT`.

Do not use this field for percentage-based or variable discounts.
