A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

order.description:
TThe order in which payments are listed in the response.
See [SortOrder](#type-sortorder) for possible values

limit.description: The maximum number of payments to return in a single response. This value cannot exceed 200.

batch_token.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

order.description:
The order in which payments are listed in the response.
See [SortOrder](#type-sortorder) for possible values

begin_time.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. If this value is before January 1, 2013 (2013-01-01T00:00:00Z), this endpoint returns an error. Default value: The current time minus one year.

end_time.description: The end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. If this value is more than one year greater than begin_time, this endpoint returns an error. Default value: The current time.

limit.description: The maximum number of payments to return in a single response. This value cannot exceed 200.

batch_token.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

include_partial.description: Indicates whether or not to include partial payments in the response. Partial payments will have the tenders collected so far, but the itemizations will be empty until the payment is completed.

order.description:
TThe order in which payments are listed in the response.
See [SortOrder](#type-sortorder) for possible values

begin_time.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. If this value is before January 1, 2013 (2013-01-01T00:00:00Z), this endpoint returns an error. Default value: The current time minus one year.

end_time.description: The end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. If this value is more than one year greater than begin_time, this endpoint returns an error. Default value: The current time.

limit.description: The approximate number of refunds to return in a single response. Default: 100. Max: 200. Response may contain more results than the prescribed limit when refunds are made simultaneously to multiple tenders in a payment or when refunds are generated in an exchange to account for the value of returned goods.

batch_token.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

order.description:
The order in which settlements are listed in the response.
See [SortOrder](#type-sortorder) for possible values

begin_time.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. If this value is before January 1, 2013 (2013-01-01T00:00:00Z), this endpoint returns an error. Default value: The current time minus one year.

end_time.description: The end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. If this value is more than one year greater than begin_time, this endpoint returns an error. Default value: The current time.

limit.description: The maximum number of settlements to return in a single response. This value cannot exceed 200.

status.description:
Provide this parameter to retrieve only settlements with a particular status (SENT or FAILED).
See [V1ListSettlementsRequestStatus](#type-v1listsettlementsrequeststatus) for possible values

batch_token.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

order.description:
The order in which timecards are listed in the response, based on their created_at field.
See [SortOrder](#type-sortorder) for possible values

employee_id.description: If provided, the endpoint returns only timecards for the employee with the specified ID.

begin_clockin_time.description: If filtering results by their clockin_time field, the beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

end_clockin_time.description: If filtering results by their clockin_time field, the end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

begin_clockout_time.description: If filtering results by their clockout_time field, the beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

end_clockout_time.description: If filtering results by their clockout_time field, the end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

begin_updated_at.description: If filtering results by their updated_at field, the beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

end_updated_at.description: If filtering results by their updated_at field, the end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

deleted.description: If true, only deleted timecards are returned. If false, only valid timecards are returned.If you don't provide this parameter, both valid and deleted timecards are returned.

limit.description: The maximum integer number of employee entities to return in a single response. Default 100, maximum 200.

batch_token.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

name.description: The name associated with the merchant account.

email.description: The email address associated with the merchant account.

account_type.description:
Indicates whether the merchant account corresponds to a single-location account (LOCATION) or a business account (BUSINESS). This value is almost always LOCATION.
See [V1MerchantAccountType](#type-v1merchantaccounttype) for possible values

account_capabilities.description: Capabilities that are enabled for the merchant's Square account. Capabilities that are not listed in this array are not enabled for the account.

country_code.description: The country associated with the merchant account, in ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 format.

language_code.description: The language associated with the merchant account, in BCP 47 format.

currency_code.description: The currency associated with the merchant account, in ISO 4217 format. For example, the currency code for US dollars is USD.

business_name.description: The name of the merchant's business.

business_address.description: The address of the merchant's business.

business_phone.description: The phone number of the merchant's business.

business_type.description:
The type of business operated by the merchant.
See [V1MerchantBusinessType](#type-v1merchantbusinesstype) for possible values

location_details.description: Additional information for a single-location account specified by its associated business account, if it has one.

market_url.description: The URL of the merchant's online store.

V1Merchant.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **RetrieveBusiness** endpoint.

nickname.description: The nickname assigned to the single-location account by the parent business. This value appears in the parent business's multi-location dashboard.

V1MerchantLocationDetails.description: Additional information for a single-location account specified by its associated business account, if it has one.

name.description: The modifier list's name.

selection_type.description:
Indicates whether MULTIPLE options or a SINGLE option from the modifier list can be applied to a single item.
See [V1ModifierListSelectionType](#type-v1modifierlistselectiontype) for possible values

modifier_options.description: The options included in the modifier list.

v2_id.description: The ID of the CatalogObject in the Connect v2 API. Objects that are shared across multiple locations share the same v2 ID.

name.description: The modifier option's name.

on_by_default.description: If true, the modifier option is the default option in a modifier list for which selection_type is SINGLE.

ordinal.description: Indicates the modifier option's list position when displayed in Square Point of Sale and the merchant dashboard. If more than one modifier option in the same modifier list has the same ordinal value, those options are displayed in alphabetical order.

modifier_list_id.description: The ID of the modifier list the option belongs to.

v2_id.description: The ID of the CatalogObject in the Connect v2 API. Objects that are shared across multiple locations share the same v2 ID.

amount.description:
Amount in the lowest denominated value of this Currency. E.g. in USD
these are cents, in JPY they are Yen (which do not have a 'cent' concept).

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

buyer_email.description: The email address of the order's buyer.

recipient_name.description: The name of the order's buyer.

recipient_phone_number.description: The phone number to use for the order's delivery.

state.description:
Whether the tax is an ADDITIVE tax or an INCLUSIVE tax.
See [V1OrderState](#type-v1orderstate) for possible values

shipping_address.description: The address to ship the order to.

subtotal_money.description: The amount of all items purchased in the order, before taxes and shipping.

total_shipping_money.description: The shipping cost for the order.

total_tax_money.description: The total of all taxes applied to the order.

total_price_money.description: The total cost of the order.

total_discount_money.description: The total of all discounts applied to the order.

created_at.description: The time when the order was created, in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: The time when the order was last modified, in ISO 8601 format.

expires_at.description: The time when the order expires if no action is taken, in ISO 8601 format.

payment_id.description: The unique identifier of the payment associated with the order.

buyer_note.description: A note provided by the buyer when the order was created, if any.

completed_note.description: A note provided by the merchant when the order's state was set to COMPLETED, if any

refunded_note.description: A note provided by the merchant when the order's state was set to REFUNDED, if any.

canceled_note.description: A note provided by the merchant when the order's state was set to CANCELED, if any.

tender.description: The tender used to pay for the order.

order_history.description: The history of actions associated with the order.

promo_code.description: The promo code provided by the buyer, if any.

btc_receive_address.description: For Bitcoin transactions, the address that the buyer sent Bitcoin to.

btc_price_satoshi.description: For Bitcoin transactions, the price of the buyer's order in satoshi (100 million satoshi equals 1 BTC).

action.description:
The type of action performed on the order.
See [V1OrderHistoryEntryAction](#type-v1orderhistoryentryaction) for possible values

created_at.description: The time when the action was performed, in ISO 8601 format.

name.description: The page's name, if any.

page_index.description: The page's position in the merchant's list of pages. Always an integer between 0 and 6, inclusive.

cells.description: The cells included on the page.

page_id.description: The unique identifier of the page the cell is included on.

row.description: The row of the cell. Always an integer between 0 and 4, inclusive.

column.description: The column of the cell. Always an integer between 0 and 4, inclusive.

object_type.description:
The type of entity represented in the cell (ITEM, DISCOUNT, CATEGORY, or PLACEHOLDER).
See [V1PageCellObjectType](#type-v1pagecellobjecttype) for possible values

object_id.description: The unique identifier of the entity represented in the cell. Not present for cells with an object_type of PLACEHOLDER.

placeholder_type.description:
For a cell with an object_type of PLACEHOLDER, this value indicates the cell's special behavior.
See [V1PageCellPlaceholderType](#type-v1pagecellplaceholdertype) for possible values

merchant_id.description: The unique identifier of the merchant that took the payment.

created_at.description: The time when the payment was created, in ISO 8601 format. Reflects the time of the first payment if the object represents an incomplete partial payment, and the time of the last or complete payment otherwise.

creator_id.description: The unique identifier of the Square account that took the payment.

device.description: The device that took the payment.

payment_url.description: The URL of the payment's detail page in the merchant dashboard. The merchant must be signed in to the merchant dashboard to view this page.

receipt_url.description:
The URL of the receipt for the payment. Note that for split tender
payments, this URL corresponds to the receipt for the first tender
listed in the payment's tender field. Each Tender object has its own
receipt_url field you can use to get the other receipts associated with
a split tender payment.

inclusive_tax_money.description: The sum of all inclusive taxes associated with the payment.

additive_tax_money.description: The sum of all additive taxes associated with the payment.

tax_money.description: The total of all taxes applied to the payment. This is always the sum of inclusive_tax_money and additive_tax_money.

tip_money.description: The total of all tips applied to the payment.

discount_money.description: The total of all discounts applied to the payment.

total_collected_money.description: The total of all discounts applied to the payment.

processing_fee_money.description: The total of all processing fees collected by Square for the payment.

net_total_money.description: The amount to be deposited into the merchant's bank account for the payment.

refunded_money.description: The total of all refunds applied to the payment.

swedish_rounding_money.description: The total of all sales, including any applicable taxes, rounded to the smallest legal unit of currency (e.g., the nearest penny in USD, the nearest nickel in CAD)

gross_sales_money.description: The total of all sales, including any applicable taxes.

net_sales_money.description: The total of all sales, minus any applicable taxes.

inclusive_tax.description: All of the inclusive taxes associated with the payment.

additive_tax.description: All of the additive taxes associated with the payment.

tender.description: All of the tenders associated with the payment.

refunds.description: All of the refunds applied to the payment. Note that the value of all refunds on a payment can exceed the value of all tenders if a merchant chooses to refund money to a tender after previously accepting returned goods as part of an exchange.

itemizations.description: The items purchased in the payment.

surcharge_money.description: The total of all surcharges applied to the payment.

surcharges.description: A list of all surcharges associated with the payment.

is_partial.description:
Indicates whether or not the payment is only partially paid for.
If true, this payment will have the tenders collected so far, but the
itemizations will be empty until the payment is completed.

V1Payment.description:
A payment represents a paid transaction between a Square merchant and a customer. Payment details are usually available from Connect API endpoints within a few minutes after the transaction completes. Each Payment object includes several fields that end in `_money`. These fields describe the various amounts of money that contribute to the payment total:
  • Monetary values are positive if they represent an increase in the amount of money the merchant receives (e.g., tax_money, tip_money).
  • Monetary values are negative if they represent an decrease in the amount of money the merchant receives (e.g., discount_money, refunded_money).

name.description: The discount's name.

applied_money.description: The amount of money that this discount adds to the payment (note that this value is always negative or zero).

discount_id.description: The ID of the applied discount, if available. Discounts applied in older versions of Square Register might not have an ID.

category_name.description: The name of the item's merchant-defined category, if any.

sku.description: The item's merchant-defined SKU, if any.

item_id.description: The unique ID of the item purchased, if any.

item_variation_id.description: The unique ID of the item variation purchased, if any.

name.description: The item's name.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item purchased. This can be a decimal value.

itemization_type.description:
The type of purchase that the itemization represents, such as an ITEM or CUSTOM_AMOUNT
See [V1PaymentItemizationItemizationType](#type-v1paymentitemizationitemizationtype) for possible values

item_detail.description: Details of the item, including its unique identifier and the identifier of the item variation purchased.

notes.description: Notes entered by the merchant about the item at the time of payment, if any.

item_variation_name.description: The name of the item variation purchased, if any.

total_money.description: The total cost of the item, including all taxes and discounts.

single_quantity_money.description: The cost of a single unit of this item.

gross_sales_money.description: The total cost of the itemization and its modifiers, not including taxes or discounts.

discount_money.description: The total of all discounts applied to the itemization. This value is always negative or zero.

net_sales_money.description: The sum of gross_sales_money and discount_money.

taxes.description: All taxes applied to this itemization.

discounts.description: All discounts applied to this itemization.

modifiers.description: All modifier options applied to this itemization.

V1PaymentItemization.description:
Payment include an` itemizations` field that lists the items purchased, along with associated fees, modifiers, and discounts. Each itemization has an `itemization_type` field that indicates which of the following the itemization represents:
  • An item variation from the merchant's item library
  • A custom monetary amount
  • An action performed on a Square gift card, such as activating or reloading it.
*Note**: itemization information included in a `Payment` object reflects details collected **at the time of the payment**. Details such as the name or price of items might have changed since the payment was processed.

name.description: The modifier option's name.

applied_money.description: The amount of money that this modifier option adds to the payment.

modifier_option_id.description: TThe ID of the applied modifier option, if available. Modifier options applied in older versions of Square Register might not have an ID.

name.description: The name of the surcharge.

applied_money.description: The amount of money applied to the order as a result of the surcharge.

rate.description: The amount of the surcharge as a percentage. The percentage is provided as a string representing the decimal equivalent of the percentage. For example, "0.7" corresponds to a 7% surcharge. Exactly one of rate or amount_money should be set.

amount_money.description: The amount of the surcharge as a Money object. Exactly one of rate or amount_money should be set.

type.description:
Indicates the source of the surcharge. For example, if it was applied as an automatic gratuity for a large group.
See [V1PaymentSurchargeType](#type-v1paymentsurchargetype) for possible values

taxable.description: Indicates whether the surcharge is taxable.

taxes.description: The list of taxes that should be applied to the surcharge.

surcharge_id.description: A Square-issued unique identifier associated with the surcharge.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

name.description: The merchant-defined name of the tax.

applied_money.description: The amount of money that this tax adds to the payment.

rate.description: The rate of the tax, as a string representation of a decimal number. A value of 0.07 corresponds to a rate of 7%.

inclusion_type.description:
Whether the tax is an ADDITIVE tax or an INCLUSIVE tax.
See [V1PaymentTaxInclusionType](#type-v1paymenttaxinclusiontype) for possible values

fee_id.description: The ID of the tax, if available. Taxes applied in older versions of Square Register might not have an ID.

calling_code.description: The phone number's international calling code. For US phone numbers, this value is +1.

type.description:
The type of refund
See [V1RefundType](#type-v1refundtype) for possible values

reason.description: The merchant-specified reason for the refund.

refunded_money.description: The amount of money refunded. This amount is always negative.

refunded_processing_fee_money.description: The amount of processing fee money refunded. This amount is always positive.

refunded_tax_money.description: The total amount of tax money refunded. This amount is always negative.

refunded_additive_tax_money.description: The amount of additive tax money refunded. This amount is always negative.

refunded_additive_tax.description: All of the additive taxes associated with the refund.

refunded_inclusive_tax_money.description: The amount of inclusive tax money refunded. This amount is always negative.

refunded_inclusive_tax.description: All of the inclusive taxes associated with the refund.

refunded_tip_money.description: The amount of tip money refunded. This amount is always negative.

refunded_discount_money.description: The amount of discount money refunded. This amount is always positive.

refunded_surcharge_money.description: The amount of surcharge money refunded. This amount is always negative.

refunded_surcharges.description: A list of all surcharges associated with the refund.

created_at.description: The time when the merchant initiated the refund for Square to process, in ISO 8601 format.

processed_at.description: The time when Square processed the refund on behalf of the merchant, in ISO 8601 format.

payment_id.description: A Square-issued ID associated with the refund. For single-tender refunds, payment_id is the ID of the original payment ID. For split-tender refunds, payment_id is the ID of the original tender. For exchange-based refunds (is_exchange == true), payment_id is the ID of the original payment ID even if the payment includes other tenders.

is_exchange.description: Indicates whether or not the refund is associated with an exchange. If is_exchange is true, the refund reflects the value of goods returned in the exchange not the total money refunded.

status.description:
The settlement's current status.
See [V1SettlementStatus](#type-v1settlementstatus) for possible values

total_money.description: The amount of money involved in the settlement. A positive amount indicates a deposit, and a negative amount indicates a withdrawal. This amount is never zero.

initiated_at.description: The time when the settlement was submitted for deposit or withdrawal, in ISO 8601 format.

bank_account_id.description: The Square-issued unique identifier for the bank account associated with the settlement.

entries.description: The entries included in this settlement.

type.description:
The settlement's current status.
See [V1SettlementEntryType](#type-v1settlemententrytype) for possible values

amount_money.description: The total amount of money this entry contributes to the total settlement amount.

fee_money.description: The amount of all Square fees associated with this settlement entry. This value is always negative or zero.

type.description:
The type of tender.
See [V1TenderType](#type-v1tendertype) for possible values

name.description: A human-readable description of the tender.

employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that processed the tender.

receipt_url.description: The URL of the receipt for the tender.

card_brand.description:
The brand of credit card provided.
See [V1TenderCardBrand](#type-v1tendercardbrand) for possible values

pan_suffix.description: The last four digits of the provided credit card's account number.

entry_method.description:
The tender's unique ID.
See [V1TenderEntryMethod](#type-v1tenderentrymethod) for possible values

payment_note.description: Notes entered by the merchant about the tender at the time of payment, if any. Typically only present for tender with the type: OTHER.

total_money.description: The total amount of money provided in this form of tender.

tendered_money.description: The amount of total_money applied to the payment.

tendered_at.description: The time when the tender was created, in ISO 8601 format.

settled_at.description: The time when the tender was settled, in ISO 8601 format.

change_back_money.description: The amount of total_money returned to the buyer as change.

refunded_money.description: The total of all refunds applied to this tender. This amount is always negative or zero.

is_exchange.description: Indicates whether or not the tender is associated with an exchange. If is_exchange is true, the tender represents the value of goods returned in an exchange not the actual money paid. The exchange value reduces the tender amounts needed to pay for items purchased in the exchange.

V1Tender.description:
A tender represents a discrete monetary exchange. Square represents this
exchange as a money object with a specific currency and amount, where the
amount is given in the smallest denomination of the given currency.

Square POS can accept more than one form of tender for a single payment (such
as by splitting a bill between a credit card and a gift card). The `tender`
field of the Payment object lists all forms of tender used for the payment.

Split tender payments behave slightly differently from single tender payments:

The receipt_url for a split tender corresponds only to the first tender listed
in the tender field. To get the receipt URLs for the remaining tenders, use
the receipt_url fields of the corresponding Tender objects.

*A note on gift cards**: when a customer purchases a Square gift card from a
merchant, the merchant receives the full amount of the gift card in the
associated payment.

When that gift card is used as a tender, the balance of the gift card is
reduced and the merchant receives no funds. A `Tender` object with a type of
`SQUARE_GIFT_CARD` indicates a gift card was used for some or all of the
associated payment.

employee_id.description: The ID of the employee the timecard is associated with.

deleted.description: If true, the timecard was deleted by the merchant, and it is no longer valid.

clockin_time.description: The clock-in time for the timecard, in ISO 8601 format.

clockout_time.description: The clock-out time for the timecard, in ISO 8601 format. Provide this value only if importing timecard information from another system.

clockin_location_id.description: The ID of the location the employee clocked in from. We strongly reccomend providing a clockin_location_id. Square uses the clockin_location_id to determine a timecards timezone and overtime rules.

clockout_location_id.description: The ID of the location the employee clocked out from. Provide this value only if importing timecard information from another system.

created_at.description: The time when the timecard was created, in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: The time when the timecard was most recently updated, in ISO 8601 format.

regular_seconds_worked.description: The total number of regular (non-overtime) seconds worked in the timecard.

overtime_seconds_worked.description: The total number of overtime seconds worked in the timecard.

doubletime_seconds_worked.description: The total number of doubletime seconds worked in the timecard.

V1Timecard.description: Represents a timecard for an employee.

event_type.description:
The ID of the timecard to list events for.
See [V1TimecardEventEventType](#type-v1timecardeventeventtype) for possible values

clockin_time.description: The time the employee clocked in, in ISO 8601 format.

clockout_time.description: The time the employee clocked out, in ISO 8601 format.

created_at.description: The time when the event was created, in ISO 8601 format.

name.description: The item variation's name.

item_id.description: The ID of the variation's associated item.

ordinal.description: Indicates the variation's list position when displayed in Square Point of Sale and the merchant dashboard. If more than one variation for the same item has the same ordinal value, those variations are displayed in alphabetical order

Indicates whether the item variation's price is fixed or determined at the time of sale.

VoidTransactionResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the [VoidTransaction](#endpoint-voidtransaction) endpoint.

team_member_id.description: The unique ID of the `TeamMember` whom this wage setting describes.

job_assignments.description:
Required The ordered list of jobs that the team member is assigned to. The first job assignment is considered the team member's "Primary Job".
Min Length 1 Max Length 12

is_overtime_exempt.description: Whether the team member is exempt from the overtime rules of the seller country.

version.description:
Used for resolving concurrency issues; request will fail if version
provided does not match server version at time of request. If not provided,
Square executes a blind write, potentially overwriting data from another write. Read
about [optimistic concurrency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/docs/working-with-apis/optimistic-concurrency)
in Square APIs for more information.

created_at.description:
The timestamp in RFC 3339 format describing when the wage setting object was created.
Ex: "2018-10-04T04:00:00-07:00" or "2019-02-05T12:00:00Z"

updated_at.description:
The timestamp in RFC 3339 format describing when the wage setting object was last updated.
Ex: "2018-10-04T04:00:00-07:00" or "2019-02-05T12:00:00Z"

WageSetting.description: An object representing a team member's wage information.

start_of_week.description:
The day of the week on which a business week cuts over for
compensation purposes.
See [Weekday](#type-weekday) for possible values

start_of_day_local_time.description:
The local time at which a business week cuts over. Represented as a
string in `HH:MM` format (`HH:MM:SS` is also accepted, but seconds are
truncated).

version.description:
Used for resolving concurrency issues; request will fail if version
provided does not match server version at time of request. If not provided,
Square executes a blind write; potentially overwriting data from another
write.

created_at.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format; presented in UTC

updated_at.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format; presented in UTC

WorkweekConfig.description:
Sets the Day of the week and hour of the day that a business starts a
work week. Used for the calculation of overtime pay.
